title: 112_s1592
content: The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligibility for farm loans is addressed in the act. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act, also known as the Farm Ownership Loans amendment, revises eligibility requirements for farm loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. The Secretary can now determine appropriate legal entities for loan eligibility. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act, also known as the Farm Ownership Loans amendment, allows the Secretary to determine suitable legal entities for loan eligibility, including limited liability companies and other entities deemed appropriate. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act allows the Secretary to determine suitable legal entities for loan eligibility, including limited liability companies and other entities deemed appropriate. Amendments include expanding the definition of eligible entities to include those determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act allows the Secretary to determine suitable legal entities for loan eligibility, including limited liability companies and other entities deemed appropriate. Amendments include expanding the definition of eligible entities to include such other legal entities as determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act allows the Secretary to determine suitable legal entities for loan eligibility, including limited liability companies and other entities deemed appropriate. Amendments include expanding the definition of eligible entities to include such other legal entities as determined appropriate by the Secretary, with special rules regarding determinations. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act allows the Secretary to determine suitable legal entities for loan eligibility, including limited liability companies and other entities deemed appropriate. Amendments include expanding the definition of eligible entities to include such other legal entities as determined appropriate by the Secretary, with special rules regarding determinations for operating-only entities. The Secretary can determine eligibility for operating-only entities in family farms based on ownership percentages exceeding 50 percent or as deemed appropriate. The Secretary determines ownership eligibility for family farm operators based on ownership percentages exceeding 50 percent or as deemed appropriate. An entity owned by other entities must meet the direct ownership requirement. The Secretary determines ownership eligibility for family farm operators based on ownership percentages exceeding 50 percent. An entity owned by other entities must meet the direct ownership requirement by having at least 75 percent ownership interests owned directly or indirectly by individuals who own the family farm. The ownership requirement for family farm operators is that at least 75 percent of each embedded entity's ownership interests must be owned directly or indirectly by individuals who own the family farm. Additionally, the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary for conservation loans. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary for conservation loans and farm operating loans. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include additional legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary for conservation and farm operating loans. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include additional legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary for conservation and farm operating loans. The amendment involves expanding the definition of eligible entities to include various legal entities as determined by the Secretary. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include additional legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary for conservation and farm operating loans, expanding the definition of eligible entities. This involves striking specific references and replacing them with more general language. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include special rules for entities owned by other entities, requiring at least 75 percent ownership by individuals who own the family farm for eligibility. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to require that at least 75 percent of the ownership interests of each embedded entity be owned directly or indirectly by individuals who own the family farm for eligibility for emergency loans. The Rural Development Act (7 U.S.C. 1961(a)) is amended to specify ownership requirements for eligibility for emergency loans. The Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for eligibility for emergency loans, including owner-operators or operators for farm ownership loans and limited liability companies or other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary for loans under subtitle B. The Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for eligibility for emergency loans, including limited liability companies or other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for eligibility for emergency loans, including limited liability companies or other legal entities as determined appropriate by the Secretary. The amendment includes changes to the proviso regarding ownership and operator qualifications. The Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for emergency loan eligibility, including entities owned by individuals with direct or indirect ownership interests in other entities. The Rural Development Act is amended to specify ownership requirements for emergency loan eligibility, including entities owned by individuals with direct or indirect ownership interests in other entities. PURPOSES OF CERTAIN DIRECT LOANS amended to include refinancing of loans made under this subtitle. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF CERTAIN LOAN TERM LIMITS. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF CERTAIN LOAN TERM LIMITS. Amends sections in the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to remove loan term limits and eligibility restrictions for guaranteed assistance.
